intro: Rhinanthus beyeri, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in grasslands and meadows, often forming dense clusters. Rhinanthus beyeri is known for its ecological role in promoting plant diversity by reducing the dominance of grasses in its habitat.
